channel.title: INtech
channel.description: This is an interleaved feed of the most recent entries from INtech, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: The Green Economy Is Hungry for Copper—and People Are Stealing, Fighting, and Dying to Feed It
item.description: With the possible exception of gold, no other metal has caused as much destruction as copper. In the coming years, we’ll need more of it than ever.

item.title: Opkey, an AI-based ERP testing platform, raises $47M
item.description: Companies are experimenting with services like ChatGPT to help workers write memos, answer questions, and much more, yet one of the clearest signs of ...

item.title: Mike Lynch, ‘Britain’s Bill Gates,’ Confirmed Dead in Superyacht Wreck
item.description: The serial software entrepreneur's passing comes only weeks after he was cleared of fraud by a jury in the US.

item.title: Kenyan HR and payroll startup Workpay lands Visa as investor in $5M round
item.description: Workpay provides cloud-based HR, payroll, and benefits solutions for businesses with employees across Africa. © 2024 TechCrunch. All rights reserved. ...

item.title: Japan Launches a Development Project for Self-Driving EV Taxis
item.description: The autonomous-driving startup Tier IV aims to put Japanese-made electric robotaxis into service on Tokyo roads later this year, with its own open-sou...

item.title: VC leading Bolt’s hoped-for $450M deal confirms he’s offering ‘marketing credits’
item.description: Ashesh Shah, the founder and CEO of The London Fund is, as you might imagine, bullish on Bolt. The London Fund is a U.K. venture firm with “over $1 bi...

item.title: Bayesian Yacht Sinking: Climate Change Created Perfect Storm for Waterspouts
item.description: While the exact cause of the deadly sinking of the Bayesian superyacht remains unknown, dangerous waterspouts were spotted in the area. Scientists say...

item.title: Bolt’s Breslow faces uphill battle with proposed cramdown
item.description: Bolt’s aggressive ultimatum to its existing shareholders will be an expensive uphill battle, an expert familiar with Bolt’s corporate charter tells Te...

item.title: Stadiums Are Embracing Face Recognition. Privacy Advocates Say They Should Stick to Sports
item.description: Protesters took to Citi Field Wednesday to raise awareness of the facial recognition systems that have become common at major league sporting venues.
